meanings.definition: Occurring at the same time as high tide.
meanings.sent1: The cotidal waves reached the shore simultaneously.
meanings.sent2: The sailors studied the cotidal patterns to plan their voyage.
meanings.sent3: The cotidal dance of the waves seemed like a synchronized performance.
meanings.sent4: The cotidal rhythm of the ocean was like a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The cotidal waves crashing against the rocks created a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to tides that have the same time of high water.
meanings.sent1: The cotidal phenomenon was observed during the research expedition.
meanings.sent2: The scientists measured the cotidal levels to understand the tidal cycle.
meanings.sent3: The cotidal synchronization of the waves was like a perfectly timed orchestra.
meanings.sent4: The cotidal effect on marine life was crucial for their survival.
meanings.sent5: The cotidal alignment of the tides was a remarkable natural occurrence.
